job_title: Admissions Coordinator, RN in Las Vegas, NV
pros: The majority of the staff was great, very family oriented, salary reasonable and an overall great team to work with; Time off policies were very flexible and kept a good work/life balance.
cons: My particular position lacked education and training as well as a defined set of tasks/responsibilities.  Management issues for that unit (organization and listening skills lacking) as well as understanding everyone's position.  It's hard to have a manager managing nurses for example when they know nothing about nurses and they are not a nurse.  Also on a smaller unit you don't have as many resources and staff coverage, so you end up being well rounded in covering other's positions so they can have days off.

job_title: Executive Director Technician/Unit Coordinator in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Pay and benefits are good.
cons:
The working environment here is like high school with ashtrays. Unless you kiss everyone's butts, or are one of the "cool kids", you'll barely get a hello from anyone. There are painfully obvious cliques, and everyone looks down their noses at you. This is NOT a fun place to be! 
The "training" is extremely poorly organized, averages about 9 shifts over 3 weeks, and you're expected to know it all by then, or you're going to be looked upon as an idiot, and spoken to as such.

job_title: Clinical Staff in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Friendly CEO (Sam) who knows everyones name and staff who care about patients. There are some really great managers there as well. Great payscale.
cons: Seasonal patients so it is busy in winter and not so busy in summer. Have to use PTO to cover shifts missed when there are not a lot of patients to treat. This is common at all hospitals in Vegas though.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Great work atmosphere. Good teamwork and coworkers. A lot experience in differents areas. Love working in a hospital setting and working with the patients.
cons: Very little over time offered. Not much opportunity for advancement. Would like to learn new things and get new experience in different areas.

job_title: Dietary Aide in Las Vegas, NV
pros: The Employees Are So Friendly It's A Good Place To Work For
cons: The Pay It's Not So Great For Working So Much Hours You Work Is Not Worth It.

job_title: Human Resources Coordinator in Las Vegas, NV
pros: I work around great people, my HR team is the best.
cons: The only downside is that we've been without an HR Director for so long our HR reputation has taken a fall, but now we have a great director that is pulling things together.
